availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Harrodsburg, Kentucky, home for aged and infirm U.S. military veterans. Established by U.S. Statute. An act was further passed to sell the buildings and grounds during 1860-61.

ab.bibl:
John P. Deeben, _Caring for Veterans in the Nation’s Capital: Records of the U.S. Soldiers’ Home in Washington, D.C., 1851–1943, Spring 2015, Vol. 47, No. 1, Genealogy Notes, https://www.archives.gov/publications/prologue/2015/spring/soldiers-home.html#page-header (accessed December 16, 2019).
Martha Stephenson, "Old Graham Springs: At Harrodsburg, Kentucky, Once the Most Fashionable Summer Resort in the State—Now Only a Memory of the Past." Register of Kentucky State Historical Society, Vol. 12, no. 34 (1914): 25-35. www.jstor.org/stable/23367448.
